# UseMods - Full Documentation

Complete documentation for all UseMods functions, optimized for AI and LLM consumption.

Base URL: https://usemods.com

---

# UseMods Documentation

Complete documentation for all UseMods functions, optimized for AI and LLM consumption.

## Table of Contents

- [Formatters](#formatters)
- [Modifiers](#modifiers)
- [Generators](#generators)
- [Actions](#actions)
- [Numbers](#numbers)
- [Data](#data)
- [Validators](#validators)
- [Detections](#detections)
- [Devices](#devices)
- [Goodies](#goodies)

---

# Formatters

Wrangle wild data types into submission. Spruce up numbers, give strings smarts, and make complex content dazzle.

## Functions

### formatNumber

**Description:** Format numbers into neat and formatted strings for people

**Parameters:**
- `number` (`number`)
- `options?` (`{
    decimals?: number
    locale?: string
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatCurrency

**Description:** Format numbers into local currency with extra smarts

**Parameters:**
- `number` (`number`)
- `options?` (`{
    decimals?: number
    locale?: string
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatValuation

**Description:** Format numbers into valuations displayed in thousands, millions or billions

**Parameters:**
- `number` (`number`)
- `options?` (`{
    decimals?: number
    locale?: string
    currency?: string
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatUnit

**Description:** Format a number into a your unit of choice

**Parameters:**
- `number` (`number`)
- `options` (`{
    unit: string
    decimals?: number
    unitDisplay?: 'short' | 'long'
    locale?: string
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatPercentage

**Description:** Format a number into a percentage

**Parameters:**
- `number` (`number`)
- `options?` (`{
    decimals?: number
    locale?: string
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatCombinedDates

**Description:** Collapses two dates (or timestamps) into a human-readable string

**Parameters:**
- `from` (`Date | string | number`)
- `to` (`Date | string | number`)
- `options` (`{ locale?: string, format?: 'short' | 'long', timeZone?: string } = { locale: 'en-US', format: 'long' }`)

**Returns:** `string`

Time is optional and will only be shown if day, month and year are the same

### formatDurationLabels

**Description:** Format time into a human-readable string

**Parameters:**
- `seconds` (`number`)
- `options?` (`{
    labels?: 'short' | 'long'
    round?: boolean
    decimals?: number
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatDurationNumbers

**Description:** Format time into duration 00:00:00

**Parameters:**
- `seconds` (`number`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatFileSize

**Description:** Format and auto calculate file size into human-readable string

**Parameters:**
- `number` (`number`)
- `options?` (`{
    decimals?: number
    inputUnit?: string
    outputUnit?: string
    unitDisplay?: 'short' | 'long'
    locale?: string
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatLength

**Description:** Format and auto calculate length into human-readable string

**Parameters:**
- `number` (`number`)
- `options?` (`{
    decimals?: number
    inputUnit?: string
    outputUnit?: string
    unitDisplay?: 'short' | 'long'
    locale?: string
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatTemperature

**Description:** Format and auto calculate temperature into human-readable string

**Parameters:**
- `number` (`number`)
- `options?` (`{
    decimals?: number
    inputUnit?: string
    outputUnit?: string
    unitDisplay?: 'short' | 'long'
    locale?: string
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatNumberToWords

**Description:** Format numbers into words

**Parameters:**
- `number` (`number`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatParagraphs

**Description:** Formats content into paragraphs with a minimum number of characters per sentence and minimum number of sentences per paragraph

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)
- `options?` (`{
    minSentenceCount?: number
    minCharacterCount?: number
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

Use whitespace-pre-wrap to ensure the whitespace is preserved

### formatInitials

**Description:** Generate initials from any string while ignoring common titles

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)
- `options?` (`{ length?: number }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatUnixTime

**Description:** Format Unix timestamp into a datetime string

**Parameters:**
- `timestamp?` (`number`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatList

**Description:** Create a string of comma-separated values from an array, object, or string with an optional limit and conjunction

**Parameters:**
- `items` (`string | object | string[]`)
- `options?` (`{
    limit?: number
    conjunction?: string
  }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatTitle

**Description:** Converts a string to title case following the Chicago Manual of Style rules.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatSentenceCase

**Description:** Format a sentence case string

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### formatTextWrap

**Description:** Adds a space between the last two words in a string to prevent lonely words.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

Remember `text-wrap: pretty` and `text-wrap: balance` are available for most browsers.


---

# Modifiers

Modify and transform your content with our collection of efficient and easy-to-use functions designed to dicipher, manipulate, and transform strings.

## Functions

### startWith

**Description:** Adds a prefix to a string if it doesn't already start with the prefix.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)
- `start` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### startWithout

**Description:** Removes a prefix from a string if it starts with the prefix.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)
- `start` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### endWith

**Description:** Adds a suffix to a string if it doesn't already end with the suffix.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)
- `end` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### endWithout

**Description:** Removes a suffix from a string if it ends with the suffix.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)
- `end` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### surroundWith

**Description:** Adds a prefix and suffix to a string if it doesn't already start and end with them.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)
- `start` (`string`)
- `end` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### pluralize

**Description:** Adds plurals to a string except for excluded words.

**Parameters:**
- `word` (`string`)
- `count` (`number`)

**Returns:** `string`

This handles most english pluralisation rules, but there are exceptions.

### singularize

**Description:** Removes plurals from a string.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

This handles most english pluralisation rules, but there are exceptions.

### ordinalize

**Description:** Converts a number to a string with ordinal suffix.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)

**Returns:** `string`

### stripHtml

**Description:** Strip HTML tags from a string efficiently, compatible with SSR.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### stripWhitespace

**Description:** Strips whitespace from a string.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### stripNumbers

**Description:** Strips numbers from a string.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### stripPunctuation

**Description:** Strips punctuation from a string.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### stripSymbols

**Description:** Strips symbols from a string.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### stripEmojis

**Description:** Strips emojis from a string (requires ES6 Unicode support) ðŸ¦Š.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### slugify

**Description:** Converts a string to-a-slug.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### deslugify

**Description:** Converts a slug to a string.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### camelCase

**Description:** Removes spaces and capitalizes the first letter of each word except for the first word.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### pascalCase

**Description:** Removes spaces and capitalizes the first letter of each word.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### snakeCase

**Description:** Replaces spaces with underscores and converts to lowercase.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### kebabCase

**Description:** Replaces spaces with hyphens and converts to lowercase.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### titleCase

**Description:** Converts to title case by capitalizing the first letter of each word.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### escapeHtml

**Description:** Escape HTML entities in a string.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### unescapeHtml

**Description:** Unescape HTML entities in a string.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`


---

# Generators

A collection of magical functions that conjure data out of thin air.

## Functions

### generateNumber

**Description:** Generate a random number

**Parameters:**
- `length` (`number`)

**Returns:** `number`

### generateNumberBetween

**Description:** Generate a random number within an inclusive range.

**Parameters:**
- `from` (`number`)
- `to` (`number`)

**Returns:** `number`

### generateUuid4

**Description:** Generate a Version 4 UUID (cryptographically random)

**Returns:** `string`

### generateUuid7

**Description:** Generate a Version 7 UUID encoding a Unix timestamp in the first 6 bytes and filling the rest with random bytes.

**Returns:** `string`

### decodeUuid7

**Description:** Decode a UUIDv7 string into a timestamp

**Parameters:**
- `uuid` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### generateShortUuid

**Description:** Encodes a standard UUID (with dashes) into a URL-safe Base64 variant

**Parameters:**
- `uuid` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### decodeShortUuid

**Description:** Decodes a short URL-safe Base64-encoded string back into a standard UUID

**Parameters:**
- `shortUuid` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### generateShortId

**Description:** Generate a unique short ID based on the current timestamp

**Parameters:**
- `length` (`number = 19`)

**Returns:** `string`

### generatePassword

**Description:** Generate a random, secure password with a mix of character types and pleasant special characters.

**Parameters:**
- `options` (`{ length?: number, uppercase?: number, numbers?: number, number?: number, symbols?: number, special?: number } = {}`)

**Returns:** `string`

Don't forget to use our Password Checker in the Goodies section

### generateRandomIndex

**Description:** Random number generator using cryptographic methods to avoid random().

**Parameters:**
- `max` (`number`)

**Returns:** `number`

### generateLoremIpsum

**Description:** Generate Lorem Ipsum text in various formats.

**Parameters:**
- `count` (`number = 5`)
- `options?` (`{ format: 'words' | 'sentences' | 'paragraphs' }`)

**Returns:** `string`

### generateHighResolutionTime

**Description:** Helper function to get high-resolution time using process.hrtime, or performance.now as a fallback.

**Returns:** `bigint`

Node.js times generated are in nanoseconds, browser-based falls back to converting performance.now to microseconds.

### getSecureRandomValues

**Description:** Returns an array filled with cryptographic random bytes.

**Parameters:**
- `buffer` (`Uint8Array`)

**Returns:** `Uint8Array`


---

# Actions

A stack of handy functions you could write yourself, but don't want to.

## Functions

### scrollToAnchor

**Description:** Smoothly scrolls to the element with the specified ID without scuffing up your URLs.

**Parameters:**
- `id` (`string`)

**Returns:** `Promise<void>`

### toggleBodyScroll

**Description:** Toggles the body scroll with specified class names and returns a promise

**Parameters:**
- `className` (`string = 'fixed'`)
- `action` (`'add' | 'remove' | 'toggle' = 'toggle'`)

**Returns:** `Promise<void>`

Use your own class names, or ensure fixed is within your Tailwindcss JIT

### toggleElementScroll

**Description:** Toggles the element scroll with specified class names and returns a promise

**Parameters:**
- `element` (`HTMLElement`)

**Returns:** `Promise<void>`

### toggleFullScreen

**Description:** Copies a convereted string to the clipboard

**Returns:** `Promise<void>`

### resetForm

**Description:** Resets a form to its initial state

**Parameters:**
- `form` (`HTMLFormElement`)

**Returns:** `Promise<void>`

### focusOnInvalid

**Description:** Focuses on and scrolls to the first invalid input, select, or textarea element within a form.

**Parameters:**
- `container` (`HTMLElement`)

**Returns:** `Promise<void>`

### focusOnNth

**Description:** Focuses on the nth element within the specified form, where 0 is the first element and -1 is the last element.

**Parameters:**
- `container` (`HTMLElement`)
- `index` (`number = 0`)

**Returns:** `Promise<void>`

### focusTrap

**Description:** Sets up a keyboard trap within an HTML element, allowing the focus to cycle between the first and last focusable elements when the Tab key is pressed.

**Parameters:**
- `container` (`HTMLElement`)

**Returns:** `void`

### debounce

**Description:** Runs a function only if there are no new calls during the delay

**Returns:** `void`

### throttle

**Description:** Throttles a function to ensure it only runs once per threshold

**Returns:** `void`


---

# Numbers

This file contains functions that are related to numbers.

## Functions

### sum

**Description:** Calculates the sum of an array of numbers.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)

**Returns:** `number`

### mean

**Description:** Calculates the mean of an array of numbers.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)

**Returns:** `number`

### average

**Description:** Calculates the mean of an array of numbers.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)

**Returns:** `number`

### margin

**Description:** Calculates the margin based on a percentage.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)
- `percentage` (`number`)

**Returns:** `number`

### addMargin

**Description:** Adds the margin to the value.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)
- `percentage` (`number`)

**Returns:** `number`

### subtractMargin

**Description:** Subtracts the margin from the value.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)
- `percentage` (`number`)

**Returns:** `number`

### addMarkup

**Description:** Adds the markup to the value.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)
- `percentage` (`number`)

**Returns:** `number`

### subtractMarkup

**Description:** Calculates the markup based on a percentage.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)
- `percentage` (`number`)

**Returns:** `number`

### median

**Description:** Calculates the median of an array of numbers.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)

**Returns:** `number`

### mode

**Description:** Calculates the mode of an array of numbers.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)

**Returns:** `number[]`

### min

**Description:** Finds the minimum value in an array of numbers.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)

**Returns:** `number`

### max

**Description:** Finds the maximum value in an array of numbers.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)

**Returns:** `number`

### minMax

**Description:** Returns the minimum and maximum values in an array of numbers.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)

**Returns:** `[number, number]`

### range

**Description:** Returns the difference between two values, expressed as a positive number.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)

**Returns:** `number`

### standardDeviation

**Description:** Returns the standard deviation of an array of numbers.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)
- `options?` (`{ method: 'sample' | 'population' }`)

**Returns:** `number`

### skewness

**Description:** Returns the measure of asymmetry of the probability distribution of an array of numbers. The skewness value can be positive, zero, negative, or undefined.

**Parameters:**
- `numbers` (`number[]`)

**Returns:** `number`


---

# Data

A collection of functions for formatting, filtering and taming wild arrays and objects.

## Functions

### dataSortBy

**Description:** Sort an array or object by a property.

**Parameters:**
- `items` (`object | string[] | number[]`)
- `options?` (`{ property?: string, order?: 'asc' | 'desc' }`)

**Returns:** `object`

### dataReverse

**Description:** Reverse an array or object.

**Returns:** `void`

### dataRemoveDuplicates

**Description:** Returns single unique values within an array or object

**Returns:** `void`

### dataFlatten

**Description:** Flatten an array of arrays or an object of objects into a single array or object. That was hard to say.

**Returns:** `void`

### dataWithout

**Description:** Returns an array without a property or properties.

**Returns:** `void`


---

# Validators

A collection of validators for common data types

## Functions

### isEmail

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid email address.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isNumber

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid number.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isUrl

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid URL.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isEmpty

**Description:** Check if any given string, array or object is empty.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string | string[] | number[] | object | null | undefined`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isUuid

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid UUID.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isJson

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid JSON string.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isObject

**Description:** Check if any given value is an object.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isArray

**Description:** Check if any given value is an array.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string[] | number[]`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isHex

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid hexadecimal color code.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isAlphabetic

**Description:** Check if any given value contains only alphabetic characters.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isAlphanumeric

**Description:** Check if any given value contains only alphanumeric characters.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isBoolean

**Description:** Check if any given value is a boolean value.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isUndefined

**Description:** Check if any given value is undefined.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isNull

**Description:** Check if any given value is null.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isDate

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid Date object.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isTime

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid time in HH:mm format.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isLeapYear

**Description:** Check if any given value year is a leap year.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isEven

**Description:** Check if the number is even.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isOdd

**Description:** Check if the number is odd.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isPositive

**Description:** Check if the number is positive.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isNegative

**Description:** Check if the number is negative.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isZero

**Description:** Check if the number is zero.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isOver9000

**Description:** Check if the number is over 9000.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isPrime

**Description:** Check if the number is a prime number.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isInteger

**Description:** Check if the number is an integer.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isFloat

**Description:** Check if the number is a float.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isBetween

**Description:** Check if the number is between the specified range.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)
- `min` (`number`)
- `max` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isDivisibleBy

**Description:** Check if the number is divisible by the specified number.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)
- `divisor` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isCreditCard

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid credit card number.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`unknown`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isLatLng

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid latitude-longitude coordinate in the format lat,lng or lat,lng.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isLatitude

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid latitude coordinate.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isLongitude

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid longitude coordinate.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isIpAddress

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid IP address.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isPort

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid port number.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`number`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isMacAddress

**Description:** Check if any given value is a valid MAC address.

**Parameters:**
- `value` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`


---

# Detections

Client-side detections for various user and browser information. Perfect for personalisation, analytics or debugging weird and wonderful bugs. You will need to add a listeners for reactivity.

## Functions

### detectScrollPosition

**Description:** Detect the current scroll position of the window

**Returns:** `void`

### detectMousePosition

**Description:** Detect the absolute mouse position with the page

**Parameters:**
- `event` (`MouseEvent`)

**Returns:** `void`

Don't forget to add a mousemove event listener to the window

### detectRelativeMousePosition

**Description:** Detect the relative mouse position with the window size and returns a percentage value

**Parameters:**
- `event` (`MouseEvent`)

**Returns:** `void`

Don't forget to add a mousemove event listener to the window

### detectWindowSize

**Description:** Detect the browser's window size

**Returns:** `void`

### detectScreenSize

**Description:** Detect the screen or monitor size

**Returns:** `void`

### detectActiveBrowser

**Description:** Detect if the browser window is currently active or hidden.

**Returns:** `boolean`

### detectColorScheme

**Description:** Detect the current color scheme (Light or Dark)

**Returns:** `string`

### detectUserTimezone

**Description:** Detect the current user's Timezone

**Returns:** `string`

### detectBreakpoint

**Description:** Detect the current breakpoint based on Tailwind CSS breakpoints

**Returns:** `string`

Add a listener to the window resize event to detect changes

### detectContainerBreakpoint

**Description:** Detect any container breakpoint based on Tailwind CSS breakpoints

**Parameters:**
- `element` (`HTMLElement`)

**Returns:** `string`

Add a listener to the window resize event to detect changes

### detectNetworkStatus

**Description:** Detect the current network status of the user (Online or Offline)

**Returns:** `string`

### detectUrl

**Description:** Returns the current URL

**Returns:** `string`

### detectUrlPath

**Description:** Returns the path of the current URL as an array or string

**Parameters:**
- `format` (`'array' | 'string' = 'array'`)

**Returns:** `string[]`

### detectUrlParams

**Description:** Returns a value from the URL by name

**Parameters:**
- `format` (`'string' | 'object' = 'string'`)

**Returns:** `void`

### detectUrlHash

**Description:** Returns a value from the URL hash by name

**Returns:** `string`

### detectHost

**Description:** Returns the current host or domain name from the URL

**Returns:** `string`

### detectHostName

**Description:** Returns the current hostname from the URL

**Returns:** `string`

### detectPort

**Description:** Returns the current port

**Returns:** `string`


---

# Devices

Client-side detections user's machines.

## Functions

### isServerSide

**Description:** Check if you're a server-side user.

**Returns:** `boolean`

### detectUserDevice

**Description:** Detects the user's device based on the user agent string and returns the information as an object.

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `object`

### addDeviceClasses

**Description:** Adds detected devices as classes to your project's body class

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `void`

### detectDevice

**Description:** Detect the current device type (Mobile or Desktop)

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### detectBrowser

**Description:** Detect the current browser

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### detectOS

**Description:** Detect the current operating system

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### isIos

**Description:** Check if you're a passionate iPhone fan.

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isAndroid

**Description:** Check if you're a zealous Android fan.

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isMac

**Description:** Check if you're a staunch Mac fan.

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isWindows

**Description:** Check if you're a fervent Windows fan.

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isLinux

**Description:** Check if you're a devoted Linux fan.

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

Fun fact, most Linux users will tell you they have Linux before the function does.

### isChrome

**Description:** Check if you're a die-hard Chrome fan.

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isFirefox

**Description:** Check if you're a dedicated Firefox fan.

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isSafari

**Description:** Check if you're a lonely Safari fan.

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isEdge

**Description:** Check if you're an ardent Edge fan.

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isMobile

**Description:** Check if you're rocking a mobile

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isTablet

**Description:** Check if you're tablet user

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isDesktop

**Description:** Check if you're pro desktop user

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isPortrait

**Description:** Check if you're portrait

**Parameters:**
- `win?` (`{ innerWidth: number, innerHeight: number }`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isLandscape

**Description:** Check if you're landscape

**Parameters:**
- `win?` (`{ innerWidth: number, innerHeight: number }`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isBot

**Description:** Check if you're a cyborg or a bot

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isHuman

**Description:** Check if you're a human

**Parameters:**
- `userAgent?` (`string`)

**Returns:** `boolean`

### isDeveloper

**Description:** Check if you're a developer by checking the environment variable

**Returns:** `boolean`


---

# Goodies

A collection neat little functions that don't belong anywhere else.

## Functions

### splitByWords

**Description:** Wraps each word, sentence or paragraph in a string with a tag.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

Don't forget to render the HTML safely.

### checkPasswordStrength

**Description:** Check the strength of a password against a given policy.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)
- `options` (`{ length?: number, uppercase?: number, number?: number, special?: number } = {}`)

**Returns:** `object`

Don't forget to use our Password Generator in the Generators section

### mergeFields

**Description:** Replaces placeholders in a string with values from an object.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)
- `fields` (`Record<string | number`)

**Returns:** `string`

### readingTime

**Description:** Returns the reading time of a string in Hours, Minutes, and Seconds.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)

**Returns:** `string`

### countBy

**Description:** Count by character, word, sentence, paragraph or unique string.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)
- `options` (`{
    by?: 'character' | 'word' | 'sentence' | 'paragraph' | 'unique'
    searchFor?: string
  } = {}`)

**Returns:** `number`

### animateText

**Description:** Animate text by wrapping each character in a span with a delay.

**Parameters:**
- `text` (`string`)
- `options` (`{
    splitBy?: 'word' | 'character'
    time?: number
    unit?: 'ms' | 's'
    class?: string
  } = {}`)

**Returns:** `string`


---
